bibl.note: This is a letter dated July 5, 1838 from James King to his son Henry King. In much of the letter, King offers advice to his son concerning military matters, discipline, and the attributes of a good soldier.

opener.add:
From
Coln Colonel
J James . M Moore . King

div.p:
I understand their is objections to Coln Colonel Yoakum on account of his strict disciplin, here
here I will remark for your instruction in future, so far as an officer acts consistantly consistently in the purformance performance of his duty, in keeping good order and strict disciplin in camps, he should never be complained of, but should be more highly regarded, and meritoriously applauded; and where ever their is complaints of that kind by soaldiers be assured it is more for the want of longer experience in camps, than propriety in complaining,

This you may discover in two companies, the officers of one company being disposed to use the orthority authority to subject his company under good order and strict disciplin, and the other to neglect, his duty and the company to become disorderly __

Will it not be preceived perceived at once without the orderly and strict disciplin, nothing could be done in company will purform their duty with ease and facility; whilst the other is always in difficulty confusion, and never ready to do any thing,_ and the officers that will not keep good order, and strict disciplin in camps will bring degrade himself and his soaldiers,__ Mr Harrison informed me you wished me to meet you with a horse on your return that that you must'nt mustn't expect, its not far, and it wont do for a soaldier soldier to complain of a little fatigue tho, I rote wrote to Majr Major Molloy to get a pony for your mother, If could get one that was good conditioned and rode will well , If he gets one you can have the use of it home
You will inform Mr Mister
Snell his father died on wednesday Wednesday night the 13 of June about one Oclock O'clock _ Dr Doctor
Becton died last friday night, tell Mr Ransom their fathers family are well, The friends and neighbours neighbors are generally well, My respects to majr major Mollory To Capt Captain McLun & officers and to all their Soaldiers soldiers tell them we expect to give them a fine Barbycue barbecue , on their return__ I saw Esgr Jamison and Ganaway yesterday them and families are well sho show this to Wm William & Abert, tell them houdy howdy _
Myself your mother, and family are all well and join me in love and esteem to you__ Write me__
div.closer:
Your Father
Ja James
M Moore King H.A J. King
